course.subject: ECON
course.name: Labor Economics and Human Resources
course.description: Occupational choice; labor market analysis and determination of earnings; unions and collective bargaining; employment and job turnover; family, fertility and population issues; training, health, and human capital.
course.prerequisites: One of ECON 3113 or ECON 3014

reviews.author: Sun
reviews.comment_content:
Labor Supply
Labor Demand
Market Equilibrium
and different specific topics about Labor ECONOMICS
e.g. Human Capital Theory, Discrimination, Union & Migration.

Before and in the Mid-Term, You need to apply the content you learn from previous Micro ECON course (say ECON 3014), like indifference curves and other skills.

After mid-term, almost no calculation involved, different specific topics about Labor ECONOMICS would be discussed. Final exam would be in essay type and also  no calculation involved.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Basically no notes. you need to write down everything discussed in lecture.

Student need to attend the lecture and read the book in order to have full understanding !

The textbook is really good, you must read it for exam and assignment.

Sometimes the Prof hold the different views towards some particular issue, you need to follow Prof and not the textbook.

Prof can recognize all the students' name and face.
If you are absent from 1 lecture, Prof will tell you not to miss again in the next lecture.
reviews.comment_grading:
The Grading is Good and maybe the best I have come across in UST.

Even I get below mean 0.4 SD in Mid term (35%) and 0.2 SD assignment (20%) but above mean 1 SD in FINAL (40%), I got A-.

The Prof is so nice for giving good grade.
reviews.comment_workload:
4 Assignment +
Mid-term +
Final +
no tutorial +
no attendance required

Super hing zone for a 4000-level and 4 credit courses.

reviews.author: Dono
reviews.comment_content:
Topics include education & training, labour supply and welfare programmes, migration, minimum wages and discrimination.
Intended learning outcomes includes
1. define key concepts related to labour markets
2. explain the optimisation process behind labour supply and demand, analyse
labour market equilibria and welfare programmes
3. understand and analyse the effects of migration on labour markets, both in
the short and long term
4. understand and analyse the effects of minimum wages on labour market
outcomes
5. discuss different theories about the role of human capital in labour markets
6. analyse the phenomenon of labour market discrimination, design ways to
measure it and analyse its labour market consequences
7. communicate own thoughts and analysis about economic phenomena and
economic logic in written and oral formats
reviews.comment_teaching: Professor Sujata’s teaching is good. She always welcome questions and willing to discuss with students thoroughly. Path is moderate so most student could catch up the progress while do not get bored. There’s also adequate diagram analysis and theory discussion I the lecture to help you understand the topic.
reviews.comment_grading:
Class Participation 15%
Homework Assignments/Quizzes 35%
2 Analysis of Real-world Questions (Team Exercise) 30%
Individual Final Quiz 20%
reviews.comment_workload: Require a lot of in class participation and team work. The group project has to be finished WITHIN the lecture, including research and PowerPoint slides. Also there are some required readings
